key_questions:
---

## EBNF (spec reference used by both linters)

```ebnf
function_calls  ::= "<function_calls" version_attr session? turn

? ">" invoke+ "</function_calls>"
version_attr    ::= ' version="2"'
session         ::= ' session_id="' ID '"'
turn            ::= ' turn_id="' ID '"'
invoke          ::= "<invoke" id timeout retry
? cache
? depends
? digest
? ">" tool_name parameters expect

? "</invoke>"
id              ::= ' id="ivk_' INT '"'
timeout         ::= ' timeout_ms="' INT '"'
retry           ::= ' retry="' ("0"|"1") '"'
cache           ::= ' cache_key="' TEXT '"'
depends         ::= ' depends_on="ivk_' INT '"'
digest          ::= ' invocation_digest="sha256:' HEX '"'
tool_name       ::= "<tool_name>" NAME "</tool_name>"
parameters      ::= "<parameters>" ( JSON | PARAMS ) "</parameters>"
expect          ::= "<expect>" TEXT "</expect>"
```

> The linters below **don’t parse EBNF** directly; they enforce the rules implied by it

?: string[];
  defaults

?: Record<string, unknown>;
  max_timeout_ms

contradiction_map.statement_b:
missing depends_on')
        if dep and ivk_id and ids
